page.title: 07THE KNUTSFORD GUARDIAN
page.content: The Knutsford Guardian is 125 years old this year, 1985. About 20,000 people read the Knutsford Guardian each week. It has always been a very popular local paper. The man who started the Guardian was called Dr.Alexander Mackie. Today the Guardian has four journalists and one photographer to cover the Knutsford area. Altogether there are nine people who work for the Guardian. The Guardian prints 6,500 papers a week. It takes four working days and one press day to print. The funniest story they have ever printed is about a girl taking her rabbit for a walk every day because the vet said it was too fat. The Guardian may be introducing colour into the paper in the future and the present editor, Mr. Wilson, would like to change to tabloid size.
